metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27840 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in samba. Spaces used in a string around a domain name (DN), while supposed to be ignored, can cause invalid DN strings with spaces to instead write a zero-byte into out-of-bounds memory, resulting in a crash. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27840` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldb-tools - 2:1.1.24-1ubuntu3.2
libldb1 - 2:1.1.24-1ubuntu3.2
python-ldb - 2:1.1.24-1ubuntu3.2
python3-ldb - 2:1.1.24-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This issue is actually in the ldb package, the samba package uses the system ldb library, not the included one

criterions.comment: ldb package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.1.24-1ubuntu3.2').
